Traits.Name: Regeneration
Traits.Content: The Synthetic Vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

Traits.Name: Life Siphon
Traits.Content: Whenever the Synthetic Vampire reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The Synthetic Vampire makes three attacks: one with Blood Drain and two with Talon Strike.

Actions.Name: Blood Drain
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) necrotic damage plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the Synthetic Vampire can't use this attack against another target.

Actions.Name: Talon Strike
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Shadow Veil (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: The Synthetic Vampire envelops itself in swirling mist, becoming heavily obscured for 1 minute. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Synthetic Vampire must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 30 (6d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. While in this state, the Synthetic Vampire has advantage on Stealth checks.
